text: [Music]
and perhaps the strangest example of
extreme specialization turned up here at
the Horniman Museum in South London one
morning someone brought them something
they'd found in their fish supper they
basically brought us someone's evening
meal on the plate so it was a cooked
fish and that the person had started to
eat halfway through their meal they
discovered this inside the fish's mouth
it was enough to put anyone off their
food so this is simon forensic you are
the fish tongue louse and it has a
really unusual parasitic lifestyle it
enters the gills of the fish and then
attaches to the tongue like structure of
the fish and kind of clings on and
pierces the tongue structure with its
big claws and then basically feeds off
the blood of the tongue which eventually
just becomes quite shriveled and it ends
up being at just a little stump that the
fish tongue Mouse then moves further
into the mouth and basically starts to
live as as if it was the term of the
fish
you
